WorkItem.ClosedComment: Resolved in Revision 38441 - all food buffs no longer apply stats directly to Warlock pet.
WorkItem.Description:
This issue has existed longer than version 2.2.24.  I just got around to posting it now.  I am a destro lock with an imp out. If you open the enclosed .xml file and look at the food buff section you will see:
 
1) Spell Power food (pet portion) = 30.79
2) Fish Feast (pet portion) = 4.14
3) points assigned to the caster for BOTH foods = 60.36 <-- that is good
 
Now I know that SP food = 46 SP/40Sta and FF = 46 SP/40Sta/80AP.  I could see the pet being buffed more from FF than from SP food. What is the mechanism that would give a pet more points for the SP food buffs when those buffs are fewer than the FF buffs?
 
I am hoping that this may give you insight into toher lock or global issues.
 
Thanks for your work.
WorkItem.Summary: [Warlock] Spell Power Food vs Fish Feast for Pets
